info.name: OsmoX
info.description: OsmoX API helps creating new notifications, fetching existing notifications as well as perform authorization related tasks.

item.name: Authentication

exec: pm.test("Response contains a valid 'login' object", function () {
pm.test("Response contains valid 'token' and 'user' values", function () {

request.description: Allows successfully logging in and obtaining the auth token from API.

exec: pm.test("Response for failed login with invalid credentials", function () {

request.description: Allows representing failure while logging in when passing invalid credentials.

exec: pm.test("Response for failed login with missing password", function () {
pm.expect(pm.response.json().errors[0].message).to.equal("Field \"LoginUserInput.password\" of required type \"String!\" was not provided.");

request.description: Allows representing failure while logging in when missing `password` value.

exec: pm.test("Response for failed login with bad request", function () {

request.description: Allows representing failure while logging in when using invalid/bad request.

item.description: Collection of requests pertaining to authentication related requests such as login.

item.name: All Notifications

exec: pm.test("Response contains a valid 'notifications' object", function () {
pm.test("Response contains a valid 'notifications' array", function () {

graphql.query:
query {
  notifications(
    options: {
      limit: 5
      offset: 0
      sortBy: "createdOn"
      sortOrder: DESC
      search: "sender@email.com"
      filters: [{ field: "channelType", operator: "eq", value: "1" }]
    }
  ) {
    notifications {
      applicationDetails {
        applicationId
        name
        userId
        status
        createdOn
        updatedOn
      }
      applicationId
      channelType
      createdBy
      createdOn
      data
      deliveryStatus
      id
      providerId
      result
      status
      updatedBy
      updatedOn
    }
    total,
    offset,
    limit
  }
}

request.description: Allows successfully fetching all notifications based on the options passed.

exec: pm.test("Response for fetching notifications with bad request", function () {

graphql.query:
query {
  notifications(
    options: {
      unknownValue: "Some unknown parameter"
      limit: 5
      offset: 0
      sortBy: "createdOn"
      sortOrder: DESC
      search: "sender@email.com"
      filters: [{ field: "channelType", operator: "eq", value: "1" }]
    }
  ) {
    notifications {
      applicationDetails {
        applicationId
        name
        userId
        status
        createdOn
        updatedOn
      }
      applicationId
      channelType
      createdBy
      createdOn
      data
      deliveryStatus
      id
      providerId
      result
      status
      updatedBy
      updatedOn
    }
    total,
    offset,
    limit
  }
}

request.description: Allows representing failure when fetching all notifications when using invalid/bad request.

item.name: All Providers
item.description: Collection of requests pertaining to fetching all applications.

graphql.query:
mutation CreateProvider {
    provider(createProviderInput: {
        applicationId: 5,
        unknownValue: "Some unknown parameter",
        channelType: 2,
        configuration: {},
        isEnabled: 1,
        name: "Mailgun PineStem",
        userId: 1,
    }) {
        applicationId
        channelType
        configuration
        isEnabled
        name
        userId
        createdOn
        updatedOn
        status
    }
}
